summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and defense attorney Gary Stein regarding the Professional Children's School (PCS). The emails discuss scheduling calls and the status of a subpoena for school records, specifically seeking information on third-party payments, donations, or scholarships related to Jeffrey Epstein from 1997 to 2000.

persons.name: Gary Stein
persons.role: Defense Attorney, Partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's office regarding a subpoena for records from the Professional Children's School, checking on the availability of records related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's office leading the inquiry, requesting follow-up on a subpoena for school records related to third-party payments connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Elizabeth Sullivan
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Copied on emails from the U.S. Attorney's office regarding the Professional Children's School records inquiry.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the records search, specifically regarding potential third-party payments, donations, or scholarships at the Professional Children's School between 1997 and 2000.

persons.name: Paul
persons.context: Mentioned as someone with whom the prosecutors plan to share a document and whose schedule is a factor in planning a meeting; likely a witness, colleague, or client.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating regarding a subpoena and investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's potential financial connections to a school.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys copied on correspondence related to the Epstein investigation.
Stein, as a defense attorney, is handling matters related to records concerning Epstein, implying a legal representation or advisory role.

events.title: Subpoena Follow-up Inquiry
events.description: Prosecutor Maurene Comey follows up on a voicemail from Gary Stein, asking specifically if the Professional Children's School has records from 1997-2000 of third-party payments, donations, or scholarships related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Call Scheduling
events.description: Gary Stein and Maurene Comey schedule a call to discuss the status of locating a records custodian for the Professional Children's School.

events.title: Trial Prep Discussion
events.description: Comey requests a call with Stein to check in as the trial is 'coming up soon,' indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduled Preparation Meeting
events.description: Stein and Comey finalize a meeting for the afternoon of November 16, 2021, for case preparation.

locations: Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP, 919 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was investigating whether the Professional Children's School had records (1997-2000) of third-party payments, donations, or scholarships connected to Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence indicates an active investigation or trial preparation phase in late 2021, with prosecutors and defense attorneys scheduling calls and sharing documents.
Gary Stein, a partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel, acted as a point of contact regarding school records, suggesting a role in responding to subpoenas related to Epstein.
The emails are heavily redacted for the recipient's email address, but the content shows routine legal coordination over a subpoena matter.
The timeline of emails spans from February 2020 to November 2021, showing a prolonged inquiry into the school's financial records.
